1.description: Lord of Winterfell and Warden of the North. A man of rigid honor with grey eyes and brown hair streaked with grey.

4.description: Reluctantly agrees to become Hand of the King after Jon Arryn's death. Concerned about the danger in King's Landing.

25.description: Discovers the truth about Cersei's children - they are Jaime's, not Robert's. Beginning to uncover the Lannister conspiracy.

47.description: Confronts Cersei about her children's parentage. Warns her to flee before Robert returns from hunting.

58.description: Imprisoned in the black cells after being betrayed. Accused of treason against King Joffrey.

65.description: Faces judgment at the Sept of Baelor after confessing to treason to save his daughters.

2.description: Lady of Winterfell, originally from House Tully. Auburn hair and blue eyes. Devoted mother of five.

14.description: Receives a letter from her sister Lysa claiming the Lannisters murdered Jon Arryn. Stays with Bran after his fall.

28.description: Captures Tyrion Lannister at the inn, believing he tried to kill Bran. Taking him to the Eyrie for trial.

55.description: At Riverrun with Robb's war council. Her father Lord Hoster Tully is dying.

71.description: Makes a deal with Jaime Lannister, releasing him in exchange for a promise to return her daughters.

5.description: Ned Stark's bastard son with dark hair and grey eyes. Feels like an outsider despite Ned's love.

13.description: Decides to join the Night's Watch. Leaves Winterfell with his uncle Benjen and Tyrion Lannister.

26.description: Training at Castle Black under Ser Alliser Thorne's harsh instruction. Making friends with Sam Tarly.

48.description: Sworn into the Night's Watch as a steward to Lord Commander Mormont, not a ranger as hoped.

60.description: Saves Lord Commander Mormont from a wight attack. Badly burns his hand in the process.

70.description: Receives devastating news about his father. Attempts to desert but is brought back by friends. Chosen for the Great Ranging.

3.description: Exiled princess with silver-gold hair and violet eyes. Sister to Viserys, last of the Targaryen dynasty.

11.description: Married to Khal Drogo in exchange for his army. Receives three petrified dragon eggs as a wedding gift.

36.description: Pregnant with Drogo's child. Beginning to embrace her role as Khaleesi and find her strength.

46.description: Viserys receives his promised 'crown' from Khal Drogo. Khal Drogo promises to conquer Westeros for their son.

68.description: Drogo suffers from an infected wound. Her son Rhaego is lost due to blood magic complications.

72.description: Walks into Drogo's funeral pyre with dragon eggs. Emerges unburnt with three living dragons - the first in centuries.

9.description: Dwarf with mismatched eyes and white-blond hair. Sharp wit and love of books compensate for his stature.

21.description: At the Wall, showing kindness to Jon Snow and designing a special saddle for Bran.

31.description: Captured by Catelyn Stark at the inn. Accused of attempting to murder Bran.

42.description: Wins trial by combat at the Eyrie through his champion Bronn. Gains a sellsword ally.

62.description: Appointed as acting Hand of the King by his father Tywin. Preparing to defend King's Landing.

7.description: Younger Stark daughter with brown hair and grey eyes. Wild and tomboyish, prefers swords to sewing.

15.description: Training in sword fighting with Syrio Forel, the First Sword of Braavos.

50.description: Escapes the Red Keep during the Lannister coup. Syrio Forel presumably dies protecting her.

65.description: Present at the Sept of Baelor during a shocking event. Yoren of the Night's Watch protects her.

7.description: Elder Stark daughter with auburn hair and blue eyes. Beautiful, proper, and dreams of knights and romance.

15.description: Infatuated with Prince Joffrey and life at court. Sides with Joffrey after he's attacked by Arya.

51.description: Pleads for her father's life to King Joffrey and Queen Cersei. Still believes in their mercy.

57.description: Writes letters at Cersei's command, urging her family to bend the knee to Joffrey.

65.description: Forced to witness terrible events at the Sept of Baelor. Joffrey torments her cruelly.

8.description: Seven-year-old boy who loves climbing. Has a terrible accident while climbing a tower.

14.description: In a coma after his fall. An assassin tries to kill him but is stopped by his mother and Summer.

24.description: Awakens from his coma but has no memory of the fall. Cannot use his legs.

53.description: Acting as Lord of Winterfell in Robb's absence. Using Tyrion's special saddle to ride.

66.description: Having strange dreams where he sees through Summer's eyes. The three-eyed crow calls to him.

8.description: Beautiful golden-haired Queen of the Seven Kingdoms. Having an affair with her twin brother Jaime.

25.description: All three of her children are actually Jaime's, not Robert's. Deeply protective of them.

45.description: Confronted by Ned about her children's parentage. Refuses to flee and plans to fight.

49.description: Has Robert mortally wounded during his hunt. Takes control as Queen Regent for Joffrey.

8.description: Golden-haired knight of the Kingsguard. Twin brother and secret lover of Queen Cersei. Pushes Bran from the tower.

30.description: Attacks Ned Stark in the streets of King's Landing after learning Tyrion was captured.

55.description: Leading Lannister forces in the Riverlands. Defeated and captured by Robb Stark at the Whispering Wood.

71.description: Released by Catelyn Stark in exchange for a promise to return her daughters. Sent with Brienne of Tarth.

4.description: King of the Seven Kingdoms. Once a great warrior, now grown fat with drink. Black-haired and bearded.

12.description: Names Ned Stark as Hand of the King. Deeply in debt to the Lannisters and others.

47.description: Mortally wounded by a boar during a hunt, likely due to strongwine provided by Lancel Lannister.

15.description: Crown Prince with golden hair and green eyes. Cruel and spoiled, torments others for amusement.

51.description: Becomes King after Robert's death. Shows increasing cruelty and instability.

65.description: Makes a shocking decision at the Sept of Baelor despite promises of mercy, shocking even his mother Cersei.

14.description: Eldest Stark son with auburn hair. Takes charge of Winterfell when his parents leave.

53.description: Calls the banners and marches south to free his father. Shows natural military leadership.

63.description: Wins the Battle of the Whispering Wood, capturing Jaime Lannister through clever strategy.

71.description: Declared King in the North by his bannermen after Ned's execution. The North secedes from the Seven Kingdoms.

1.description: Ward of Eddard Stark, taken as a boy after his father's rebellion. Cocky and ambitious.

53.description: Fights alongside Robb in his campaign. Dreams of glory and recognition.

26.description: Extremely overweight new recruit to the Night's Watch. Cowardly but intelligent and kind.

48.description: Becomes a steward alongside Jon. Sworn brother of the Night's Watch.

18.description: Master of Coin on the Small Council. Small man with pointed beard and grey-green eyes. Owns brothels.

35.description: Claims to be helping Ned but provides misleading information about the dagger used against Bran.

49.description: Betrays Ned Stark to Cersei. The City Watch turns on Ned at Littlefinger's command.

18.description: Master of Whisperers, a perfumed eunuch with a bald head. Has spies everywhere called 'little birds'.

30.description: Visits Ned in the throne room, speaking in riddles about serving the realm.

58.description: Visits Ned in the black cells. Claims to serve the realm but allowed Ned's imprisonment.

15.description: Huge warrior with terrible burn scars on his face. Joffrey's sworn shield, not a knight.

29.description: Tells Sansa how his brother Gregor burned his face as a child. Hates knights and hypocrites.

67.description: Shows unexpected protection of Sansa, stopping her from pushing Joffrey to his death.

42.description: Lord of Casterly Rock and Warden of the West. Richest and most powerful lord in Westeros. Ruthless and brilliant.

56.description: Leading Lannister forces against the Riverlands. Burning and pillaging to draw out Robb Stark.

69.description: Recognizes Tyrion's intelligence by making him acting Hand. Plans to crush the Stark rebellion.

3.description: Exiled prince with silver-gold hair and lilac eyes. Cruel and increasingly unstable. Obsessed with reclaiming the Iron Throne.

11.description: Sells his sister to Khal Drogo for an army. Growing impatient and disrespectful to the Dothraki.

46.description: Receives his promised 'crown' from Khal Drogo after threatening Daenerys and her unborn child.

11.description: Powerful Dothraki warlord with long braided hair never cut in defeat. Married to Daenerys.

36.description: Growing to love Daenerys. She is pregnant with his son, prophesied to be 'the stallion who mounts the world'.

46.description: Kills Viserys with molten gold. Promises to conquer Westeros for his son.

68.description: Falls into a catatonic state after blood magic ritual. Cannot speak or move.

3.description: Exiled knight from Bear Island. Middle-aged, balding, and hairy. Sworn to serve Viserys.

23.description: Shifts his loyalty from Viserys to Daenerys. Secretly reporting to Varys for a pardon.

54.description: Saves Daenerys from a poisoned wine assassination attempt. Truly loyal to her now.

72.description: First to call Daenerys 'Mother of Dragons' after she emerges from the fire with three dragons.

1.description: First Ranger of the Night's Watch. Ned's younger brother who joined the Watch years ago.

17.description: Leaves Castle Black on a ranging mission beyond the Wall. Does not return as expected.

1.description: Youngest Stark child at three years old. Wild and difficult to control.

53.description: Stays at Winterfell under Bran's care while his father and brothers are away.

14.description: Ancient servant at Winterfell, over ninety years old. Tells stories of the old days and Others.

2.description: Maester of Winterfell. Grey-haired and intelligent, serves the Stark family faithfully.

24.description: Cares for Bran after his fall, helping him adjust to his disability with patience and wisdom.

14.description: Simple-minded stableboy at Winterfell. Giant in size but gentle, can only say 'Hodor'.

7.description: Septa who serves as governess to Sansa and Arya. Tries to teach them proper ladylike behavior.

50.description: Confronts Lannister soldiers during the takeover of the Red Keep while trying to protect the Stark girls.

1.description: Master-at-arms of Winterfell. White-whiskered knight who trained the Stark children in combat.

18.description: Accompanies Catelyn to King's Landing to investigate the Valyrian steel dagger.

1.description: Captain of Ned's household guard. Loyal and competent, son of the late Martyn Cassel.

30.description: Confronts Jaime Lannister during the street fight in King's Landing.

1.description: Master of horse at Winterfell. Manages the castle's stables and horses.
Blacksmith of Winterfell. Skilled craftsman who maintains weapons and armor for the castle.

14.description: Cook at Winterfell. Manages the castle's kitchens and prepares meals for the household.

24.description: One of Lord Walder Frey's grandsons, fostered at Winterfell as a ward.
One of Lord Walder Frey's great-grandsons, fostered at Winterfell as a ward.

7.description: Ser Rodrik's young daughter. Serves as a companion to the Stark girls.
Sansa's best friend and companion. Daughter of Vayon Poole, steward of Winterfell.

50.description: Screaming hysterically during the Lannister takeover. Fate unknown after father's death.

56.description: Tywin's younger brother and most trusted advisor. Loyal and competent, serves as his second-in-command.

33.description: Young knight serving as Robert's squire. Blonde and eager to please.

47.description: Gives Robert strongwine during the hunt, contributing to the king's fatal accident.

33.description: Young Lannister cousin serving as a squire at court. Quiet and dutiful.

15.description: Robert's supposed daughter, actually fathered by Jaime. Golden-haired and sweet-natured.
Robert's supposed youngest son, actually fathered by Jaime. Gentle and plump child.

56.description: Tywin's cousin, tasked with raising troops in the Westerlands.

69.description: Son of Stafford Lannister, serves in the family's military forces.
Tywin's sister, married into House Frey. Strong-willed like her brothers.
Son of Genna Lannister and a Frey. Has Lannister blood but serves House Frey.

56.description: Kevan's twin son, serves in the Lannister forces.

25.description: Robert's middle brother, Lord of Dragonstone. Fled King's Landing before Robert's death.

49.description: Rightful heir to the Iron Throne by law, but missing when Robert dies.

25.description: Robert's youngest brother, Lord of Storm's End. Handsome and popular at court.

39.description: Suggests Ned should seize the royal children before Robert's death is announced.

25.description: Stannis Baratheon's wife from House Florent. Stern and devoted to the Lord of Light.
Stannis and Selyse's young daughter. Scarred by greyscale but intelligent and kind.
Shireen's fool at Dragonstone. Half-mad survivor of a shipwreck, speaks in riddles.
Robert's acknowledged bastard son, raised as a ward at Storm's End.

34.description: Robert's bastard daughter in the Vale. Serves as a guide in the mountains.

20.description: Robert's unacknowledged bastard son working as a smith's apprentice in King's Landing.

65.description: Taken by Yoren to join the Night's Watch, fleeing the gold cloaks hunting Robert's bastards.

20.description: Infant bastard daughter of Robert, born to a prostitute in one of Littlefinger's brothels.

51.description: Targeted by gold cloaks on Joffrey's orders during the crackdown on Robert's bastards.

6.description: Catelyn's sister, widow of Jon Arryn. Sends warning that Lannisters killed her husband.

34.description: Has become paranoid and unstable since Jon's death. Obsessively protective of her sickly son.
Sickly young Lord of the Vale, suffers from shaking fits. Spoiled by his overprotective mother.

55.description: Lord of Riverrun and Catelyn's father. Old and dying, but still maintains his authority.
Catelyn's younger brother, heir to Riverrun. Auburn-haired and well-meaning but impulsive.
Catelyn's uncle, brother to Hoster Tully. Experienced knight and military commander.

34.description: Captain of guards at the Eyrie. Loyal servant to House Arryn.

42.description: Serves as Lysa's champion in Tyrion's trial by combat. Faces Bronn in combat.

34.description: Maester serving at the Eyrie. Tends to Lord Robert's health and fits.
Brutal gaoler of the Eyrie's sky cells. Simple-minded but strong and cruel.

28.description: Handsome singer at the inn who joins Catelyn's party to the Vale for glory and songs.

42.description: Present at Tyrion's trial by combat. Plans to make a song of the events.

34.description: High Steward of the Vale, serving House Arryn faithfully for years.

19.description: Lord Commander of the Night's Watch. Gruff but fair, commands respect from his men.

48.description: Makes Jon Snow his personal steward, grooming him for leadership.

59.description: Lady of Bear Island, a fierce warrior woman who fights alongside Robb's forces.
Maege Mormont's eldest daughter. Tall and strong, fights with her mother's forces.

71.description: Young daughter of Maege Mormont, left to rule Bear Island while her mother fights.

25.description: Prince of Dorne, mentioned as one of the great lords Robert might rally to his cause.

18.description: Elderly Grand Maester serving the Iron Throne. Long white beard and seemingly frail, but sharp-minded.

25.description: Reveals information about Jon Arryn's investigations into Robert's bastards and the royal children.

49.description: Supports Joffrey's claim to the throne. Reveals his true loyalty lies with House Lannister.

18.description: Lord Commander of the Kingsguard. White-haired veteran knight with an impeccable reputation.

30.description: Disapproves of Jaime's attack on Ned in the streets. Maintains honor even in difficult times.

57.description: Dismissed from the Kingsguard by Joffrey for being 'too old'. Shocked by this unprecedented action.

18.description: King's Justice and royal executioner. Silent and grim, had his tongue torn out by Aerys II Targaryen.

65.description: Carries out the king's justice at the Sept of Baelor using Ice, the Stark Valyrian steel sword.

20.description: Commander of the City Watch (Gold Cloaks). Corrupt and ambitious, takes bribes from various factions.

49.description: Betrays Ned Stark by siding with the Lannisters during the throne room confrontation.

51.description: Orders the killing of Robert's bastard children throughout King's Landing on Joffrey's command.

30.description: Master-at-arms of the Red Keep. Dornish knight responsible for training and weapons.

33.description: Court fool of King's Landing. Entertains the royal court with jests and acrobatics.

30.description: Kingsguard knight known for his cruelty and lack of honor. Follows orders without question.

50.description: Leads the attack on Syrio Forel when hunting for Arya in the Red Keep.

67.description: Strikes Sansa on Joffrey's orders, showing his willingness to harm innocents.

51.description: Kingsguard knight assigned to protect Princess Myrcella. More honorable than some of his brothers.

49.description: Kingsguard knight present during the throne room confrontation. Follows the Lannister faction.
Vale-born Kingsguard knight with dead eyes. Dangerous and unpredictable in his loyalty.
Kingsguard knight known for his cowardice and brutality toward the weak. Fat and cruel.

67.description: Threatens Sansa on Joffrey's behalf, showing his willingness to intimidate children.

51.description: Brutal officer of the City Watch who kills Robert's bastard daughter Barra and her mother.

62.description: Captain in the City Watch, known as 'Ironhand' for his iron prosthetic hand. More honorable than most.

58.description: Gaoler in charge of the black cells beneath the Red Keep where high-value prisoners are held.
Undergaoler of the Red Keep dungeons. Actually Varys in disguise, though this is not revealed.

30.description: Young knight from Highgarden, famous for his skill in tournaments. Handsome and popular at court.

39.description: Supports Renly's claim to the throne. His loyalty lies with the Tyrells and Renly.

29.description: Massive knight, nearly eight feet tall. Sandor's older brother who burned his face as a child.

56.description: Leads raids in the Riverlands for Tywin Lannister, burning villages and terrorizing smallfolk.

20.description: Former squire to Jon Arryn who was recently knighted. Young and newly wealthy.

30.description: Faces Gregor Clegane in the Hand's Tournament, possibly to prevent him from revealing Jon Arryn's secrets.

67.description: Drunken knight saved from execution by Sansa's intervention. Made Joffrey's fool instead.

20.description: Master armorer in King's Landing. One of the few who can work Valyrian steel.

65.description: Baker's boy from King's Landing recruited by Yoren for the Night's Watch.
Dyer's apprentice from King's Landing recruited by Yoren for the Night's Watch.

13.description: Wandering crow of the Night's Watch who recruits men for the Wall. Gruff and experienced ranger.

65.description: Saves Arya from the crowd during Ned's execution, cuts her hair and disguises her as a boy.

71.description: Lord of Last Hearth, a massive and fierce northern lord loyal to House Stark. One of the most powerful bannermen in the North.
Son and heir of Jon 'Greatjon' Umber. Called 'Smalljon' to distinguish him from his father, though still a large man.
Uncle of the Greatjon, an older member of House Umber known for his fierce loyalty to the Starks.
Uncle of the Greatjon, another member of the fierce House Umber from Last Hearth.
Lord of Karhold, a stern northern lord and bannerman to House Stark. Fierce in his loyalty to the old ways.
Eldest son and heir of Lord Rickard Karstark. A young man ready to serve House Stark in war.
Son of Lord Rickard Karstark, killed by Jaime Lannister during his capture. His death fuels Karstark's hatred.
Son of Lord Rickard Karstark, killed by Jaime Lannister during his capture alongside his brother Eddard.
Lord of the Dreadfort, a soft-spoken but sinister northern lord. Known for his pale eyes and quiet manner that masks a cruel nature.
Deceased legitimate son of Roose Bolton. Died young under mysterious circumstances, leaving Roose without a proper heir.
Bastard son of Roose Bolton. Cruel and unpredictable, bearing his father's vicious nature without the restraint.
Daughter of Maege Mormont, a fierce warrior woman of Bear Island. Known for her strength and loyalty to the Starks.
Another daughter of Maege Mormont, part of the fierce Mormont women who defend Bear Island.
Another daughter of Maege Mormont, continuing the tradition of strong Mormont women.
Immensely fat Lord of White Harbor, the North's major port city. Wealthy and influential among the northern lords.
Eldest son of Lord Wyman Manderly, heir to White Harbor and its maritime wealth.
Second son of Lord Wyman Manderly, a knight ready to serve House Stark in the coming war.
Granddaughter of Lord Wyman Manderly, part of the White Harbor ruling family.
Master of Deepwood Motte, a loyal northern lord sworn to House Stark. Rules the lands near the western coast.
Brother of Galbart Glover, another member of House Glover loyal to the Starks.
Lord of Castle Cerwyn, a northern bannerman loyal to House Stark. Rules lands in the central North.
Daughter of Lord Medger Cerwyn, part of the loyal northern house sworn to the Starks.
Lady of Barrowton, a northern noblewoman with ties to multiple great houses. Known for her political acumen.
Lord of the Rills, a northern lord loyal to House Stark. Rules lands in the western North.
Son of Lord Rodrik Ryswell, heir to the Rills and loyal to House Stark.
Lord of Hornwood, a northern bannerman loyal to House Stark. Rules lands in the eastern North.
Son of Lord Halys Hornwood, heir to Hornwood and ready to serve House Stark in war.
Lord of Oldcastle, a northern bannerman loyal to House Stark.
Lady of Widow's Watch, a northern noblewoman loyal to House Stark.
Lord of Flint's Finger, a northern lord loyal to House Stark.
Chief of the mountain clan Wull, fierce warriors loyal to the Starks from the northern mountains.
Chief of the mountain clan Norrey, mountain warriors loyal to House Stark.
A member of the mountain clan Wull, known for his distinctive nickname and loyalty to the Starks.
Member of the mountain clan Liddle, mountain warriors loyal to House Stark.
Member of the mountain clan Norrey, fierce mountain warriors loyal to the Starks.
Member of the mountain clan Flint, mountain warriors who answer to House Stark's call.
Member of the mountain clan Liddle, mountain warriors loyal to House Stark.
Lord of Greywater Watch in the Neck, a close friend and ally of Eddard Stark. Known for his loyalty and knowledge of the crannogmen.
Daughter of Lord Howland Reed, skilled with net and spear like all crannogmen. Loyal to House Stark.
Son of Lord Howland Reed, young but wise beyond his years. Shows signs of greensight like many crannogmen.

11.description: One of Khal Drogo's three bloodriders present at the wedding. Sworn to die with his khal.

68.description: Remains loyal as bloodrider despite the khalasar breaking apart.

11.description: One of Khal Drogo's three bloodriders present at the wedding. Sworn to die with his khal.

68.description: Remains loyal as bloodrider despite the khalasar breaking apart.

11.description: One of Khal Drogo's three bloodriders present at the wedding. Sworn to die with his khal.

64.description: Opposes Daenerys's use of blood magic. Confronts Ser Jorah Mormont while defending her position.

23.description: A ko (lieutenant) in Khal Drogo's khalasar. Commands part of the great horde.

68.description: Declares himself khal and takes part of the khalasar. Refuses to follow Daenerys.

23.description: A ko (lieutenant) in Khal Drogo's khalasar. Commands part of the great horde.

68.description: Declares himself khal and takes part of the khalasar. Refuses to follow Daenerys.

36.description: A Dothraki warrior who challenges Drogo's orders when Daenerys saves Lhazareen women from rape.

54.description: Challenges Khal Drogo after defying his khaleesi. Faces Drogo in single combat.

36.description: A young Dothraki who serves Daenerys. One of her growing group of loyal followers.

72.description: Becomes one of Daenerys's bloodriders after she emerges from the fire with dragons.

36.description: A young Dothraki who serves Daenerys. One of her growing group of loyal followers.

72.description: Becomes one of Daenerys's bloodriders after she emerges from the fire with dragons.

36.description: A young Dothraki who serves Daenerys. One of her growing group of loyal followers.

72.description: Becomes one of Daenerys's bloodriders after she emerges from the fire with dragons.

11.description: A young Dothraki girl given to Daenerys as a wedding gift to serve as handmaid. Teaches Dany Dothraki customs.

72.description: Remains loyal to Daenerys through all hardships. Witnesses the birth of dragons.

11.description: A young Dothraki girl given to Daenerys as a wedding gift to serve as handmaid. Teaches Dany Dothraki ways.

72.description: Remains loyal to Daenerys through all hardships. Witnesses the birth of dragons.

11.description: A Lysene pleasure slave given to Daenerys as a wedding gift by Illyrio. Teaches Dany arts of love.

23.description: Teaches Daenerys about pleasing a man and gaining power through intimacy. From Lys across the sea.

3.description: A wealthy magister of Pentos who has sheltered Daenerys and Viserys. Arranges Dany's marriage to Khal Drogo.

11.description: Provides wedding gifts including the three dragon eggs. Fat and wealthy merchant with a golden smile.

3.description: A knight who served House Targaryen and raised Daenerys and Viserys in exile. Died when Dany was young.

23.description: A slave master who taught Daenerys how to ride horses in preparation for her Dothraki life.
Captain of the ship that brought Daenerys and Viserys from Pentos to meet Khal Drogo.

61.description: A Lhazareen maegi (wise woman) captured by the Dothraki. Daenerys saves her from rape and asks her to heal Drogo's wound.

64.description: Performs blood magic to save Drogo's life, demanding 'only death can pay for life.' The ritual goes wrong.

68.description: Reveals she deliberately cursed Drogo and killed Rhaego in revenge for her people's suffering.

72.description: Burned alive on Drogo's funeral pyre by Daenerys's command. Her death helps birth the dragons.

61.description: A young Lhazareen girl saved by Daenerys from Dothraki rapists during the raid on her village.

68.description: Threatened by Dothraki when the khalasar breaks apart. Daenerys struggles to protect her.

46.description: The horse god of the Dothraki, said to mount the world. Prophesied that Rhaego would be the stallion who mounts the world.

54.description: Daenerys eats the horse heart in ritual to the Great Stallion, ensuring her child will be strong.

36.description: A Dothraki warrior in Drogo's khalasar. Participates in raids and follows khalasar customs.

68.description: A young Dothraki warrior who remains with Daenerys after Drogo's death when most abandon her.

72.description: Witnesses the birth of dragons and swears loyalty to Daenerys as Mother of Dragons.

54.description: A merchant captain who trades in Vaes Dothrak, the great market city of the Dothraki.
A warlock from the great city of Qarth, mentioned among the traders who come to Vaes Dothrak.
A wealthy merchant prince from Qarth, mentioned among the exotic traders in Vaes Dothrak.
A wine merchant who attempts to poison Daenerys with poisoned wine. Actually an assassin sent to kill her.

26.description: Ancient blind maester of Castle Black. Very old and wise, respected by all at the Wall.

52.description: Reveals he is Aemon Targaryen, great-uncle to the Mad King. Gave up his claim to the throne to serve.

relationships.Jon Snow: Shares wisdom about duty vs love

19.description: Master-at-arms of Castle Black. A hard, cruel man who takes particular dislike to Jon Snow.

21.description: Former knight who fought for the Mad King. Bitter about being sent to the Wall after defeat.

26.description: Lord Steward of the Night's Watch. Manages the supplies and provisions of Castle Black.
First Builder of the Night's Watch. Oversees all construction and maintenance at Castle Black.

60.description: Acting First Ranger after Benjen Stark's disappearance. Commands the rangers in search missions.

19.description: One-armed blacksmith of Castle Black. Lost his arm serving Robert Baratheon in battle.

48.description: Skilled smith who repairs weapons and armor. Knows the Baratheon brothers well from his past service.

52.description: Maester Aemon's elderly steward. Helps the blind maester with his daily needs and duties.

73.description: Legendary ranger of the Shadow Tower. Lost fingers to wildling blade but remains formidable.

0.description: Young lordling ranger killed by White Walkers in the prologue. Arrogant but brave.
Skilled tracker and ranger. Witnesses White Walker attack in the prologue.

1.description: Deserted the Night's Watch after seeing White Walkers. Executed by Ned Stark for desertion.

0.description: Veteran ranger on the ranging with Waymar Royce. Tries to warn against pursuing wildlings.

73.description: Experienced ranger preparing for the Great Ranging beyond the Wall.
Ranger of the Night's Watch preparing for the ranging beyond the Wall.
Skilled ranger known for his climbing abilities. Serves at the Shadow Tower.

19.description: Former mummer who became Jon's friend at Castle Black. Quick-witted and good-humored.

26.description: Takes his vows with Jon and becomes a steward. Continues to be Jon's loyal friend.

19.description: Large, strong but slow-witted recruit who becomes Jon's friend. Good-hearted despite his size.

26.description: Takes his vows and becomes a ranger. Remains loyal to Jon despite their different assignments.

19.description: Night's Watch recruit training alongside Jon. Part of the group that initially bullied Sam.
Recruit training to be a builder. One of the boys who picked on Sam before Jon intervened.
Builder recruit at Castle Black. Part of the training group under Ser Alliser.
Night's Watch recruit training at Castle Black alongside Jon and the others.
Former singer from Oldtown who joined the Night's Watch. Handsome and vain, accused of rape.
Cruel and vicious recruit who particularly enjoys tormenting Sam. Jon's enemy at Castle Black.

70.description: Becomes a steward but remains cruel. Tries to prevent Jon from leaving for Winterfell.

19.description: Night's Watch recruit training at Castle Black. One of the boys in Jon's training group.
Recruit at Castle Black training alongside Jon and the other new brothers.
Chief cook at Castle Black. Lost two fingers but makes hearty meals for the Night's Watch.

26.description: The septon of Castle Black, usually drunk on wine. Performs religious ceremonies for the Watch.
Pessimistic steward known for his gloomy outlook and dry humor. Makes everything sound worse than it is.
Steward of the Night's Watch. Has difficulty speaking clearly, hence his nickname.
Orange-haired steward of the Night's Watch. One of the support staff at Castle Black.

28.description: Ancient Lord of the Crossing and the Twins. Nearly ninety years old with a sharp tongue and bitter temperament. Controls the vital bridge crossing of the Green Fork.
Walder Frey's eldest son and heir. Over sixty years old but still waiting to inherit. Somewhat more reasonable than his father.
One of Walder Frey's sons, married to Genna Lannister. This marriage ties House Frey to the Lannisters.
Son of Stevron Frey and grandson of Lord Walder. A knight of House Frey present at the Twins.
One of Walder Frey's sons, known for his large size and aggressive nature. A formidable knight of the Twins.
One of the more courteous and decent members of House Frey. Shows more honor than most of his kin.
One of Walder Frey's sons, called 'Lame Lothar' due to his twisted leg. Known for his cunning and political acumen.
One of Walder Frey's bastard sons, distinguished by his dark demeanor. Bears the bastard surname Rivers.
One of Walder Frey's many sons present at the Twins. Part of the large Frey household.
Son of Aenys Frey and great-grandson of Lord Walder. A young member of the extensive Frey family.

71.description: Lord of Seagard and a bannerman to House Tully. A seasoned warrior and loyal lord of the Riverlands.
Son and heir of Lord Jason Mallister. A young knight present when the northern lords declare for Robb.
Lord of Raventree Hall and bannerman to House Tully. Ancient enemies of House Bracken, yet loyal to the Riverlands.
Son of Lord Tytos Blackwood and a knight of Raventree Hall. Present when the lords declare Robb king.
Lord of Stone Hedge and bannerman to House Tully. Ancient enemies of House Blackwood but united in supporting the Riverlands.
A knight of House Bracken, kinsman to Lord Jonos. Present at the gathering of northern and riverlands lords.
Lord of Pinkmaiden Castle and bannerman to House Tully. A riverlands lord supporting the northern cause.
Son of Lord Clement Piper and heir to Pinkmaiden. A young knight of the Riverlands.

18.description: Master-at-arms of Riverrun, sworn to House Tully. A seasoned knight responsible for training and castle defenses.
Steward of Riverrun, managing the day-to-day operations of the castle. A trusted servant of House Tully.
Maester of Riverrun, serving House Tully. Provides counsel and medical care to the Tully household.
Captain of the guards at Riverrun, responsible for castle security and defense. A loyal knight to House Tully.
A guard at Riverrun, part of the castle's security force serving House Tully.

28.description: Innkeeper of the Inn of the Crossroads. A plump woman who runs the busy inn where many travelers stay.
A knight staying at the Inn of the Crossroads when Catelyn encounters Tyrion. Answers Catelyn's call for aid.
A man-at-arms present at the Inn of the Crossroads. Joins Catelyn in confronting Tyrion Lannister.
A man-at-arms present at the Inn of the Crossroads when Catelyn confronts Tyrion. Supports her cause.

18.description: Lady of Harrenhal, the cursed castle in the Riverlands. Rules the massive fortress with its dark reputation.
Former member of the Kingsguard under King Aerys, from House Whent of Harrenhal. Died at the Tower of Joy with Prince Rhaegar.

16.description: A butcher's son who becomes friends with Arya Stark. Practices sword fighting with her using wooden sticks.

17.description: Faces consequences on Prince Joffrey's orders after the incident with Arya and Prince Joffrey at the Trident.

34.description: Lord of Runestone and head of House Royce. Called 'Bronze Yohn' for his bronze armor covered in protective runes.
Eldest son of Lord Yohn Royce. Present at the Eyrie.
Son of Lord Yohn Royce, called 'the Red' for his auburn hair.
Lord of Redfort, one of the Vale lords present at the Eyrie.
Son of Lord Horton Redfort, present at the Eyrie.
Lady of Ironoaks, one of the prominent Vale lords present at the Eyrie.
Son of Lady Anya Waynwood, present at the Eyrie.
Lord of Strongsong, one of the Vale lords present at the Eyrie for Tyrion's trial.
Lord of Longbow Hall, one of the Vale lords present at the Eyrie.
Dangerous knight of House Corbray, wielding the Valyrian steel sword Lady Forlorn.

38.description: Present during Tyrion's trial by combat at the Eyrie.

34.description: Lord of House Corbray, brother to the dangerous Ser Lyn Corbray.
Lord of Snakewood, one of the Vale lords present at the Eyrie.
Knight of Ninestars, one of the Vale knights present at the Eyrie.
Elderly lord of House Hunter, present at the Eyrie.
Lady Lysa's personal maid at the Eyrie.
A serving woman at the Eyrie.
Young squire of House Lynderly at the Eyrie.

42.description: Leader of the Stone Crows clan. Large, fierce mountain clansman with a great axe.

56.description: Fights alongside Tyrion in battle, leading his Stone Crows warriors.

42.description: Leader of the Burned Men clan. Has burned out one of his own eyes as ritual.

56.description: Commands his Burned Men in battle alongside Tyrion and the Lannister forces.

42.description: Leader of the Black Ears clan. Wears a necklace of dried human ears.

56.description: Leads her Black Ears warriors in battle for Tyrion and the Lannisters.

42.description: Warrior of the Moon Brothers clan who joins Tyrion's service.

56.description: Fights in battle alongside the other mountain clansmen for Tyrion.

42.description: Mountain clansman who joins Tyrion's band of followers.

56.description: Fights alongside other clansmen in battle for the Lannisters.

29.description: Lord of Highgarden and Warden of the South, father to Ser Loras Tyrell.
Lady of Highgarden, wife to Lord Mace Tyrell.
Eldest son of Lord Mace Tyrell, crippled in a tourney joust.
Second son of Lord Mace Tyrell, known for his skill with a sword.
Daughter of Lord Mace Tyrell, sister to Ser Loras.
Dowager Lady of Highgarden, mother to Lord Mace Tyrell, known for her sharp wit.
Lord of the Arbor, commands a great fleet and produces the finest wines in Westeros.

26.description: Lord of Horn Hill, father to Samwell Tarly, known as one of the finest military commanders in Westeros.

41.description: Prince of Dorne, younger brother to Prince Doran, known for his skill with poison and spear.
Daughter of Prince Doran Martell, heir to Sunspear.
Youngest son of Prince Doran Martell.

30.description: A knight of House Marbrand, serves as a commander in Tywin Lannister's army.

56.description: Lord of Ashemark in the Westerlands.

33.description: A cruel knight in service to House Lannister, known for his brutality.

56.description: A knight of House Prester, serves in Tywin Lannister's army.
Lord of the Crag in the Westerlands.
Lord of Golden Tooth, controls a strategic pass in the Westerlands.
A knight of House Swyft from Cornfield in the Westerlands.

43.description: Young lord of Blackhaven in the Stormlands, sent by Ned Stark to bring Gregor Clegane to justice.

29.description: A red priest from Myr, serves at the royal court and fights in tournaments with a flaming sword.

57.description: Lord of Nightsong in the Stormlands.

58.description: A pious lord from the Stormlands known for his devotion to the Faith.
Castellan of Storm's End, loyal to the Baratheon line.

29.description: A skilled knight from the Stormlands participating in the Hand's Tournament.
One of the Redwyne twins, nicknamed 'Horror' by the court. Participates in the Hand's Tournament.
One of the Redwyne twins, nicknamed 'Slobber' by the court. Participates in the Hand's Tournament.
A freerider competing in the Hand's Tournament, later known as 'Lothor Apple-Eater'.
A member of House Frey participating in the Hand's Tournament.
A knight of House Royce from the Vale, competing in the Hand's Tournament.
A knight from House Waynwood in the Vale, participating in the tournament.
A knight from House Vance competing in the Hand's Tournament.
A knight of House Corbray participating in the Hand's Tournament.
A knight competing in the Hand's Tournament.

1.description: Steward of Winterfell, serving Lord Eddard Stark faithfully.
A guard at Winterfell in service to House Stark.
A guard at Winterfell, loyal to House Stark.
A guard serving House Stark at Winterfell.
A guard in service to House Stark at Winterfell.

7.description: Former First Sword of Braavos, now teaching Arya Stark the water dance style of swordplay.

50.description: Holds off Lannister guards to allow Arya to escape during the coup in King's Landing.

18.description: An exiled prince from the Summer Islands, now at the court in King's Landing.
A woman from the Summer Islands who owns an upscale brothel in King's Landing.
A Lysene pirate captain mentioned in the capital.

1.description: Master-at-arms of Winterfell, an old knight with white whiskers who trains the Stark children.

43.description: One of Lord Walder Frey's many sons at the Twins.

25.description: Lord of Darry in the Riverlands, a supporter of House Targaryen.
A former member of the Kingsguard who served the Targaryens, now deceased.

58.description: Lord of Claw Isle, a Targaryen loyalist house in the Crownlands.

4.description: The last Targaryen king, known as the Mad King, killed by Jaime Lannister during Robert's Rebellion.
Crown Prince and heir to the Mad King, killed by Robert Baratheon at the Battle of the Trident.

25.description: Rhaegar Targaryen's wife from Dorne, killed during the Sack of King's Landing.

4.description: Eddard's elder brother, killed by the Mad King along with their father. Was betrothed to Catelyn.
Eddard's father and former Lord of Winterfell, burned alive by the Mad King.
Eddard's sister, betrothed to Robert Baratheon but allegedly abducted by Rhaegar Targaryen.

25.description: A lady of House Dayne, rumored to have had a relationship with Eddard Stark. Died tragically.

1.description: Jon Snow's albino direwolf, the runt of the litter with red eyes and silent nature.
Robb Stark's direwolf, named for its speed and grey coloring.
Sansa Stark's direwolf, the most gentle and ladylike of the pack.

15.description: Faces consequences from Eddard Stark on Queen Cersei's orders as punishment for Nymeria's attack on Joffrey.

1.description: Arya Stark's direwolf, named after the warrior queen of the Rhoynar.

15.description: Driven away by Arya after biting Prince Joffrey to protect her mistress.

1.description: Bran Stark's direwolf, grey and black with yellow eyes.

14.description: Kills the assassin who tried to murder Bran, protecting his master.

1.description: Rickon Stark's direwolf, black with green eyes and the most aggressive of the pack.

22.description: An old black tomcat in the Red Keep, named after the great dragon Balerion the Black Dread.

18.description: The court fool at King's Landing, known for his jests and antics.

25.description: A former member of the Kingsguard who served under King Aerys II.
Former Lord Commander of the Kingsguard, known as 'The White Bull'.
A prince of Dorne who served in the Kingsguard under Aerys II.
Queen and wife to King Aerys II, mother of Rhaegar, Viserys, and Daenerys.

recaps.1: Lord Eddard Stark executes a Night's Watch deserter who speaks of White Walkers. The Stark children find six direwolf pups.
recaps.2: Catelyn tells Ned that Jon Arryn is dead and King Robert is coming to Winterfell.
recaps.3: Daenerys meets Khal Drogo for the first time. Viserys plans to use Drogo's army to reclaim the Iron Throne.
recaps.4: King Robert arrives at Winterfell and asks Ned to be his Hand. He also proposes joining their houses through marriage.
recaps.5: Jon Snow decides to join the Night's Watch. He gives Arya a sword called Needle as a farewell gift.
recaps.6: Catelyn receives a secret message claiming the Lannisters murdered Jon Arryn.
recaps.7: Arya has her first 'dancing' lesson with Syrio Forel. Ned agrees to the betrothal of Sansa and Joffrey.
recaps.8: Bran has a terrible fall while climbing the old tower at Winterfell.
recaps.9: Tyrion travels north to see the Wall, showing kindness to Jon Snow along the way.
recaps.10: Jon arrives at Castle Black and begins training with the Night's Watch recruits.
recaps.11: Daenerys marries Khal Drogo and receives three dragon eggs as a wedding gift.
recaps.12: Ned accepts Robert's offer to become Hand of the King after learning of the threat to his friend.
recaps.13: Jon befriends Samwell Tarly and protects him from the other recruits' bullying.
recaps.14: An assassin tries to kill Bran while he's in a coma. Catelyn and Summer stop the attempt.
recaps.15: Sansa is enchanted by court life while Arya begins sword training. The conflict with Joffrey leads to Lady's death.
recaps.16: Bran awakens from his coma with no memory of his fall. He cannot use his legs.
recaps.17: At the Wall, Jon learns hard truths about the Night's Watch from Tyrion.
recaps.18: Ned arrives in King's Landing and joins the Small Council. Littlefinger offers his help.
recaps.19: Jon adjusts to life at Castle Black and continues protecting Sam from Ser Alliser Thorne.
recaps.20: Ned begins investigating Jon Arryn's death. He visits the armorer where Robert's bastard works.
recaps.21: Tyrion stops at Winterfell on his way south and gives Bran plans for a special saddle.
recaps.22: Arya accidentally overhears men plotting. She tries to warn her father but isn't believed.
recaps.23: Daenerys begins to find her strength as Khaleesi. She stands up to Viserys for the first time.
recaps.24: Bran goes riding with his new saddle but is attacked by wildlings. Theon and Robb save him.
recaps.25: Ned discovers that Joffrey and his siblings are not Robert's children but Jaime's.
recaps.26: Jon and Sam take their vows and officially join the Night's Watch.
recaps.27: Ned continues investigating the Baratheon bastards and realizes the truth about Cersei's children.
recaps.28: Catelyn captures Tyrion at the inn, accusing him of attempting to murder Bran.
recaps.29: Sansa pleads with Ned to let her stay in King's Landing and marry Joffrey.
recaps.30: Jaime confronts Ned in the streets about Tyrion's capture. Ned is wounded in the fight.
recaps.31: Tyrion is taken to the Eyrie to stand trial for allegedly trying to kill Bran.
recaps.32: Arya trains with Syrio while tensions rise in King's Landing.
recaps.33: Ned resigns as Hand after Robert insists on assassinating Daenerys. They later reconcile.
recaps.34: Catelyn arrives at the Eyrie with Tyrion. Her sister Lysa has become paranoid and unstable.
recaps.35: Ned continues his investigation and plans to tell Robert the truth about his children.
recaps.36: Daenerys saves the Lazzareen women from the Dothraki warriors. She is pregnant with Drogo's child.
recaps.37: Bran has his first wolf dream, seeing through Summer's eyes.
recaps.38: Tyrion demands trial by combat. Bronn volunteers to be his champion.
recaps.39: Ned makes plans to send his daughters away from King's Landing for their safety.
recaps.40: Catelyn meets Robb's army at Moat Cailin as they march south.
recaps.41: Jon saves Lord Commander Mormont from a wight attack, burning his hand in the process.
recaps.42: Tyrion wins his freedom when Bronn defeats Lysa's champion. He gains a sellsword ally.
recaps.43: Catelyn negotiates with Walder Frey for passage across the Twins.
recaps.44: Sansa goes to Cersei and reveals Ned's plan to send them away.
recaps.45: Ned confronts Cersei about her children and warns her to flee before Robert returns.
recaps.46: Viserys threatens Daenerys and her unborn child. Drogo kills him with molten gold.
recaps.47: Robert returns from his hunt, mortally wounded. On his deathbed, he names Ned as Lord Protector.
recaps.48: Jon receives Longclaw from Lord Commander Mormont as thanks for saving his life.
recaps.49: Ned refuses to seize the throne for Stannis. Littlefinger betrays him to Cersei.
recaps.50: Arya escapes the Red Keep as Lannister guards attack. Syrio Forel holds them off.
recaps.51: Sansa pleads for her father's life before Joffrey and Cersei.
recaps.52: Jon learns about Maester Aemon's true identity as a Targaryen.
recaps.53: Bran acts as Lord of Winterfell while Robb leads the army south.
recaps.54: Daenerys eats a horse heart in a Dothraki ritual. An assassin tries to poison her but Jorah saves her.
recaps.55: Catelyn waits anxiously as Robb splits his forces to face the Lannisters.
recaps.56: Tyrion fights in his first battle with his father's army, leading the mountain clans.
recaps.57: Sansa is forced to write letters asking her family to bend the knee to Joffrey.
recaps.58: Varys visits Ned in the black cells and tries to convince him to confess.
recaps.59: Catelyn waits in the woods while Robb wins the Battle of the Whispering Wood.
recaps.60: Jon and the Night's Watch discover two missing rangers frozen beyond the Wall.
recaps.61: Drogo's wound festers. Daenerys convinces him to let Mirri Maz Duur treat it.
recaps.62: Tyrion arrives in King's Landing. His father makes him acting Hand of the King.
recaps.63: Robb captures Jaime Lannister. News arrives of Ned's imprisonment.
recaps.64: Daenerys goes into labor as Drogo lies dying. Mirri performs blood magic.
recaps.65: Arya is in the crowd at the Sept of Baelor when shocking events unfold.
recaps.66: Bran and Rickon share a prophetic dream about their father in the crypts.
recaps.67: Sansa is forced to look at terrible things by Joffrey. She contemplates pushing him off the wall.
recaps.68: Daenerys wakes to find Drogo catatonic and her son stillborn - changed by dark magic.
recaps.69: Tyrion forges an alliance with the mountain clans and prepares to defend King's Landing.
recaps.70: Jon tries to desert to avenge Ned but Sam and his friends bring him back.
recaps.71: Catelyn and Robb receive terrible news from King's Landing. The northern lords declare Robb King in the North.
recaps.72: Daenerys walks into Drogo's funeral pyre with the dragon eggs. She emerges unburnt with three baby dragons.
recaps.73: The Night's Watch prepares for the Great Ranging beyond the Wall to investigate the threat.
